iep_goals: Navigate school environment independently using mobility aids with 90% success rate
Complete assignments using assistive technology with 85% accuracy in 4 out of 5 trials
Demonstrate grade-level math skills through alternative assessment methods with 80% accuracy
Participate in physical education activities with appropriate modifications in 4 out of 5 opportunities
Develop self-advocacy skills by requesting needed accommodations with 75% success rate
Maintain organization of materials and assignments with minimal prompting in 8 out of 10 opportunities
accommodations: Large print materials and high contrast displays (Across all instructional environments)
Preferential seating-front of classroom with good lighting (Across all instructional environments)
Extended time for all assignments and assessments (GEN ED/SSC)
Use of assistive technology including screen reader (GEN ED/SSC)
Alternative format for visual materials (GEN ED/SSC)
Modified ELA testing with audio format
Modified Math testing with tactile materials
learning_styles: benefits from tactile and hands-on experiences
excels with verbal explanations and discussions
placement: 95% time in regular class & extracurricular & non academic activities, 5% time outside regular class

interviews.parent: Parent reported student was born with low vision and uses mobility aids. Very independent and academically motivated. Lives with parents and grandmother.
interviews.teacher: Student is highly motivated and participates actively in class. Uses assistive technology effectively and advocates for her needs.

observations.psychologist: Student demonstrates strong problem-solving skills and resilience. Shows excellent adaptation to visual impairment with appropriate supports in place.
